alert.note: Alert for Bell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 24 at 6:06PM EST until February 26 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Kentucky... Cumberland River at Pineville affecting Bell County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Cumberland River at Pineville. * WHEN...From this evening to Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 1002.0 feet, Low lying roads flood, including portions of Straight Creek, Dorton Branch, and Fourmile Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 PM EST Thursday the stage was 995.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 1001.7 feet by Friday morning and will continue to run high through Friday night. - Action stage is 995.0 feet. - Flood stage is 1002.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement when you can do so safely. The next statement will be issued by 11 PM.
